TopicTitle: The Survey Mission to Edwise Spot

Articles.Content:
Recently I got the contract to take a crew report above a certain Edwise Spot. I built the 2.5m rocket and got that puppy up to orbit. That's when I happened to glace over at the fuel gauge and see that the fuel for the main stage is at 50%! That was when I realised my stupendous error.

I had chosen to put RCS on my craft, and to balance the thrusters with the CoM I drained the fuel to 50%. It seemed the engineers had forgotten to fill it up again. Endo Kerman probably had a rant at them after he got back...

The mission had to go on regardless. I still had 2.2km of DV to play around with, but I had a lot of maneuverers to do - Mun injection burn, circularization burn, inclination change, course correction, ejection burn and retrograde burn. That 2.2km didn't seem so large anymore.

after the course correction I had 25 seconds of burn time... after the ejection burn 14 seconds... after the retrograde 1 second - but Endo was certainly happy to be getting home.
